--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Xavid <xavid@m...> wrote:
> I've been working on a fetcher for Heritrix that uses jCIFS 
> (http://jcifs.samba.org/) to crawl network drives.  jCIFS uses URIs 
> that have a username and password included, separated by a colon, like 
> this: 'smb://name:password@s.../'.  When I put a URL like this 
> in as a seed, however, the crawler hangs, and the seeds report shows 
> the crawler as using the seed: 'smb://name/', basically truncating it 
> at the colon.  In testing this, I noticed that it does the same thing 
> for http urls that use the same format for username and password.  I'm 
> not sure if this problem is in the UURI class or somewhere else in the 
> Heritrix code.  I'd try escaping the colon, but I believe jCIFS treats 
> escaped colons differently to allow colons to be used in passwords.  
> Any suggestions?
> 
> Xavid Pretzer

We weren't allowing seeds to have userinfo; we were mangling the
reading of such seed URIs.  I've added a fix to HEAD.

Of note is that while the userinfo is now present in the UURI thats
being passed about in the crawler, you have to go get it explicitly by
doing a UURI#getUserinfo.  This may not be sufficent for your smb'ing
-- but maybe it is.  Let us know 

(If you do UURI#toString on a UURI made from an URI that had userinfo,
the userinfo won't be present and currently there is no easy way of
getting back the original URI string (The base httpclient URI class
doesn't include userinfo in its #toString rendition of the URI)).

Yours,
